page.title: 15THINGS MADE IN AMPNEY CRUCIS
page.content: Many women have learned an art or craft by joining the W.I. It is possible to see lace making, basketry, macrame, embroidery, lampshades and cushions at W.I shows in the Village Hall. There is fine needlework, tapestry work and dressmaking done all over the area. A magnificent patchwork quilt was made by many local adults and children 4 years ago. It was raffled for church funds. The church kneelers were worked by parishioners. Sewing parties meet occasionally to make things at church bazaars. Some beautiful brightly knitted jumpers were made for Ethiopia by W.I. members. A professional potter, furniture maker, garden furniture designer and maker, and a design artist live in the area.
